SEARCH
Package cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.systems

Class DeviceSystem

java.lang.Object
cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.systems.DeviceSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FridgeSystem, GateControlSystem, HVACSystem, LightingSystem, SecuritySystem, TVSystem
public abstract class DeviceSystem extends Object implements Tickable
Abstract class representing a generic device system in the smart home simulation. This class serves as a base for specific types of device systems, providing common functionalities and properties. The purpose of device system is to aggregate devices and sensors that are related to each other.

  • Method Details

    • turnOn

      public void turnOn()
      Turns on the devices associated with this system. This method should be overridden to provide specific turn-on behavior.

    • turnOff

      public void turnOff()
      Turns off the devices associated with this system. This method should be overridden to provide specific turn-off behavior.

    • getAppliance

      public Appliance getAppliance()
      Retrieves the appliance associated with this device system.
      Returns:
      An instance of Appliance associated with this system.

    • getMotionSensor

      public MotionSensor getMotionSensor()
      Retrieves the motion sensor associated with this device system. The sensor is used to detect motion in the room where this system is located.
      Returns:
      An instance of MotionSensor associated with this system.

    • getController

      public Controller getController()
      Retrieves the controller associated with this device system. The controller is used to control the devices in this system.
      Returns:
      An instance of Controller associated with this system.

    • getUserInputSensor

      public UserInputSensor getUserInputSensor()
      Retrieves the UserInputSensor associated with this device system. The sensor is used to detect and process user inputs for this system.
      Returns:
      An instance of UserInputSensor associated with this system.
